page.title: 04CHANGING LILLIESLEAF
page.content: IN THE EARLY 1920'S THE{SHOPS}IN THE VILLAGE WERE THE POST OFFICE,IRON MONGER WITH PETROL PUMP,SADDLERS,TWO GROCERS,OF WHICH ONE TURNED INTO THE CO-OP,BAKER,TAILOR,DRAPER,SWEET SHOP,AND THE BLACKSMITHS. THE{ENTERTAINMENT}WAS PROVIDED BY THE PEOPLE THEMSELVES FOR EXAMPLE A CONCERT IN THE VILLAGE HALL,THERE WERE PICNICS AND ALSO SPORTS. THE BOYS{SCHOOL}WAS UP THE BACK ROAD THEN AND THERE WAS ONE WHERE THE PRESENT ONE IS FOR GIRLS.THEY HAD SEPERATE PLAYGROUNDS BUT ON FRIDAYS THEY WERE ALLOWED IN BOTH.THE PRESENT SCHOOL WAS BUILT IN 1962. THE{POPULATION }TENDED TO BE YOUNGER PEOPLE BECAUSE THERE WERE BIGGER FAMILIES. {TRANSPORT}HAS CHANGED IN THE LAST SIXTY OR SEVENTY YEARS.
